alert.note: Alert for Gosper (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 4:10AM CDT until August 02 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Gosper. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 408 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Gallagher Canyon State Recreation Area, Plum Creek, Johnson Lake Area, East Branch Turkey Creek, Elk Creek, Elwood Reservoir Area, Platte River, West Branch Turkey Creek and East Branch Muddy Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.2 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elwood and Johnson Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
